titles.title: Proposing a balanced budget amendment to the Constitution of the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 1/19/1995--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits the Congress from increasing the limit on the public debt of the United States without the approval of three-fifths of each House of Congress. Prohibits any bill to increase tax revenue from becoming law unless approved by three-fifths of each House. Waives these provisions when a declaration of war is in effect or when the United States by law is engaged in military conflict.
